pros:
Employees care about one another
Friendly environment
New hospital in 2018
cons:
Doesn't get the respect it deserves because it is an older building. 
Has the same capable staff as York Hospital.
Don't currently have trauma or pediatrics.

pros: The people are great, some are nicer than others as with anywhere you work, they offer bonuses a lot in the summer to add extra hours, students only have to work 200 hours a year, they target nursing students hoping to keep them on as employees
cons: Mandatory training times are inconvenient for students and requests for fridays or weekends have been ignored, scheduling holidays if you are per diem is a nightmare as you never get the times or days then get yelled at for not having holiday time at the end of the year, clinical assistants are now house keepers for the ED absolutely ridiculous, don't bother calling housekeeping for help (they ignore your calls, take 2 hour breaks all together and don't do their jobs)

pros: loved the people i worked with and all of the patients that was seen day in and day out ! Upper Management was great !
cons: A lot of drama ! The department i was in was poorly managed and staff was treated with disrespect and talked to poorly by director... she was very nasty and rude and would not allow a work life balance. Made it necessary to embarrass others and intimidate others. Never backed her employees and felt like we was always beong thrown under the bus. People are promoted based on friendship rather than quality of work.

pros: Professional but family like atmosphere.  Talented medical and support staff.  Progressive in their apporach to new initiatives for the Emergency Department and Cardiology.
cons: Leadership is not in tune with issues regaridng employee morale.  Problems are sometimes studied to death with no results.  Management in some departments need help in leadership and motivation not just sitting at a desk, pushing a pencil and demanding respect just by virtue of thier position.

pros: If you are a student looking for extra money this is the job for you. Get the experience working in a warehouse. But if have a family with small children walk away. The job is intense.
cons: There is no growth unless someones retired and there will be none. There is a team member that think is the boss and tries to give you orders and call others names. And the word communication does not exist in the department

pros: Nice coworkers, ease of access, residents are very helpful, lots of schedules to choose from
cons: Poor management in some departments that manage based solely on favoritism, lots of low census days without pay

pros: If you’re living in York County, it’s close to home. And it’s a job. Very clean facility.
cons: Incompetent supervisor. No meal discounts. Very low pay wages.

pros: Small group, like a family. Good for incoming new staff.
cons: Being such a small family, you can't escape gossip or puniation for mistakes.

pros: Small hospital with a homey feel
cons: Not all support services for patient care

pros: Close and convenient ,cafeteria has good food
cons: Leadership is poorly trained and undereducated, staff is not culturally diverse. Racially bias toward staff and patients.
